item.title: Calling Celery Tasks not from Python
item.description: Python IO streams: BytesIO and StringIO in practice. Celery is probably the most popular task queue/job queue in Python. Often you call Celery tasks from Python code. But! You can have a situation when you need to run Celery tasks from another language. The obvious solution is to have a web server (Flask / Django / etc) neer to your Celery code and execute tasks through API calls. But! This is not the ultimate solution.
